entry.title: My First Blog Here
entry.content:
Well, this is my first blog here (right now on github).

I’m using the Octopress as blog content management, and I will briefly describe the way to set it up.

First, go to Octopress setup page. Follow the instruction, install the dependencies that Octopress will need.

Then choose the platform that the blog will be hosted on, here is a link for deploying github pages. Note: a error occured while I followed the instruction to rake it.

rake aborted! You have already activated rake 10.1.0, but your Gemfile requires rake 0.9.6. Prepending bundle exec to your command may solve this. /Users/Haochen/myBlog/octopress/Rakefile:2:in `‘ (See full trace by running task with —trace) This error could be easily solved by add ‘bundle exec’ in front of the ‘rake’ command.

After ‘rake generate’, go to ‘_deploy’ folder, and type ‘git pull origin master’. Then type ‘rake deploy’. Otherwise, there will be some errors:

error: failed to push some refs to ‘git@gihub.com:your github page repo’

Now, your blog page is on-line. However, you still need version control on your Octopress settings, so don’t forget to commit the ‘source’ directory.

git add . git commit -m ‘your message’ git push origin source (I’d rather put them into a bash file than typing every time)

Finally, my blog is here. Much easier than I expected. Using Octopress can save your time on setting a blog site, and it generates pages automatically.

This blog is still underconstruction. I would like to make it more simple and pretty. K.I.S.S
